00004 /*!  \file buffer_pool.h
00005      \brief Host Driver: A driver-generated pool of buffers that it can use for 
00006                          dynamic memory allocation.
00007 */
00008 
00009 
00010 #ifndef __BUFFER_POOL_H__
00011 #define __BUFFER_POOL_H__
00012 
00013 #include "octeon_main.h"
00014 
00015 
00016 /*----------------------------   BUFFER POOL  -------------------------------*/
00017 
00018 /**  The 6 pools in the driver's buffer pool */
00019 typedef enum { huge = 0,
00020                large,
00021                medium,
00022                small,
00023                tiny,
00024                ex_tiny,
00025                os} OCTEON_BUFPOOL;
00026 
00027 
00028 
00029 
00030 
00031 /*
00032  * buffer pool management
00033  */
00034 
00035 
00036 
00037 typedef struct {
00038     unsigned long   pool;
00039     unsigned long   index;
00040 } buffer_tag;
00041 
00042 
00043 
00044 /** Configuration for the driver's buffer pool.
00045  *  Indicates the numbers of buffers to allocate at init time
00046  *  for each pool.
00047  */
00048 typedef struct {
00049 
00050   uint32_t huge_buffer_max;   /**< number in huge 32K buffer pool */
00051   uint32_t large_buffer_max;  /**< number in large 16K buffer pool */
00052   uint32_t medium_buffer_max; /**< number in medium 8K buffer pool */
00053   uint32_t small_buffer_max;  /**< number in small 4K buffer pool */
00054   uint32_t tiny_buffer_max;   /**< number in tiny 2K buffer pool */
00055   uint32_t ex_tiny_buffer_max; /**< number in ex tiny 1K buffer pool */
00056 
00057 } octeon_bufpool_config_t;
00058 
00059 
00060 
00061 /** List to keep track of fragmented buffers in the buffer pool. */
00062 typedef struct {
00063     cavium_list_t list;
00064     cavium_list_t alloc_list;
00065     uint8_t *big_buf;
00066     int frags_count;
00067     int index;
00068     OCTEON_BUFPOOL p;
00069     uint16_t free_list[MAX_FRAGMENTS];
00070     uint8_t *address[MAX_FRAGMENTS];
00071     int free_list_index;
00072     int not_allocated;
00073 } cavium_frag_buf_t;
00074 
00075 
00076 
00077 
00078 /** Each buffer pool is represented by this structure.
00079  */
00080 typedef struct {
00081   /** Lock for this pool. */
00082    cavium_spinlock_t buffer_lock;
00083 
00084   /** Number of chunks in this pool. */
00085    int chunks;
00086 
00087   /** Size of each chunk available for use after allocation. */
00088    int chunk_size;
00089 
00090   /** Actual size of each chunk. (includes size of buffer tag)*/
00091    int real_size;
00092 
00093    uint8_t *base;
00094 
00095   /** Address of each chunk. */
00096    uint8_t *address[MAX_BUFFER_CHUNKS];
00097 
00098   /** Address of usable space in chunk ( chunk - buffer tag) */
00099    uint8_t *address_trans[MAX_BUFFER_CHUNKS];
00100 
00101   /** Free list for this pool. */
00102    uint16_t free_list[MAX_BUFFER_CHUNKS];
00103 
00104   /** The next location in free list where a buffer is available. */
00105    int free_list_index;
00106 
00107   /** Start of head for this pool's fragment list.  */
00108    cavium_list_t frags_list;
00109 
00110 } cavium_buffer_t;

00118 
00119 
00120 /** Initialize the buffer pool.
00121  *   @param  octeon_dev   -  pointer to the octeon device.
00122  *   @param  bufpool_conf -  Configuration to be used to initialize 
00123  *
00124  *   The buffer pool is allocated according to chunk size and chunk count
00125  *   mentioned in bufpool_conf for each pool. There is a separate buffer
00126  *   pool for each device.
00127  *   
00128  *   @return Success: 0; Failure: 1.
00129  */
00130 uint32_t  octeon_init_buffer_pool(octeon_device_t          *octeon_dev,
00131                                 octeon_bufpool_config_t  *bufpool_conf);
00132 
00133 
00134 
00135 
00136 /** Delete the buffer pool.
00137  *  @param  octeon_dev - pointer to the octeon device.
00138  *
00139  *  Delete the buffers in the buffer pool at module unload time.
00140  */
00141 void    octeon_delete_buffer_pool(octeon_device_t   *octeon_dev);
00142 
00143 
00144 
00145 
00146 /** Get a buffer from the pool.
00147  *  @param  pdev  -  pointer to the octeon device.
00148  *  @param  size  -  size of buffer to be allocated.
00149  *
00150  *  The buffer pool  thats a best fit for the buffer size is checked for
00151  *  an available buffer. If not, then the next higher size buffer pool
00152  *  is checked. If no buffers are available, a buffer is dynamically 
00153  *  allocated and if that fails, no buffer is returned.
00154  *
00155  *  @return Success: buffer pointer; Failure: NULL
00156  */
00157 uint8_t *get_buffer_from_pool(void *pdev,int size);
00158 
00159 
00160 
00161 
00162 /** Put a buffer back into the buffer pool.
00163  *  @param  dev - pointer to the octeon device.
00164  *  @param  b   - the buffer to be released to the pool.
00165  *
00166  */
00167 void   put_buffer_in_pool(void *dev, uint8_t *b);
00168 
00169 
00170 /* Get the buffer pool statistics */
00171 void
00172 oct_get_buffer_pool_stats(oct_stats_t   *stats);

00176 #endif
